alert.note: Alert for Lapeer (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 14 at 3:02PM EDT until July 14 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Lapeer County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 302 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Columbiaville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Lum around 330 PM EDT. Imlay City around 340 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Burnside, Kings Mill and Goodland Township. This includes I-69 between mile markers 171 and 172. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: This Tornado Warning replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued for the same area. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
